CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this area chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing GeoHeat Commodity relative to SkyFlow Water Index?
SRP.A: GeoHeat Commodity is {above} SkyFlow Water Index in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total natural gas prices?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {SkyFlow Water Index}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total natural gas prices?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {GeoHeat Commodity}.

VE.Q: What is AquaSource Trading's Natural Gas Prices in 1989?
VE.A: AquaSource Trading's natural gas prices in 1989 is {1.30} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What is Zephyr Gas Index's Natural Gas Prices in 1989?
VE.A: Zephyr Gas Index's natural gas prices in 1989 is {1.30} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What is Zephyr Gas Index's Natural Gas Prices in 1981?
VE.A: Zephyr Gas Index's natural gas prices in 1981 is {1.81} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What are the natural gas prices of GeoHeat Commodity, Zephyr Gas Index, and AquaSource Trading in 1992?
VE.A: GeoHeat Commodity's natural gas prices is {0.30} $/cubic meter, Zephyr Gas Index's natural gas prices is {1.08} $/cubic meter, AquaSource Trading's natural gas prices is {1.18} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum Natural Gas Prices in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum natural gas prices is {0.07} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum Natural Gas Prices in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum natural gas prices is {3.66} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the highest Natural Gas Prices level recorded for AquaSource Trading?
EVJ.A: AquaSource Trading reached approximately {1.92} $/cubic meter in {1978}.

EVJ.Q: What is the lowest Natural Gas Prices level recorded for AquaSource Trading?
EVJ.A: AquaSource Trading's lowest recorded level is approximately {1.02} $/cubic meter in {1994}.

SC.Q: What is the average total Natural Gas Prices?
SC.A: The average total natural gas prices is {7.91} $/cubic meter.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices fall between 7.54 and 8.33 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {7.74} $/cubic meter in {1987}, {7.87} $/cubic meter in {1986}, {8.19} $/cubic meter in {1985}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices go below 6.99 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {6.15} $/cubic meter in {1993}, {5.97} $/cubic meter in {1994}, {6.32} $/cubic meter in {1992}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices exceed 8.88 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {9.05} $/cubic meter in {1982}, {9.43} $/cubic meter in {1980}, {9.77} $/cubic meter in {1979}.

NC.Q: Between 1982 and 1990, did the total Natural Gas Prices experience a larger or smaller change than between 1978 and 1981?
NC.A: The change in total natural gas prices between 1982 and 1990 was {larger} than between 1978 and 1981.

NC.Q: Was the total Natural Gas Prices in 1978 higher or lower than in 1992?
NC.A: The total natural gas prices in 1978 was {higher} than in 1992.

NC.Q: Between 1982 and 1986, did the total Natural Gas Prices experience a larger or smaller change than between 1991 and 1994?
NC.A: The change in total natural gas prices between 1982 and 1986 was {larger} than between 1991 and 1994.

NC.Q: Between 1990 and 1992, did the total Natural Gas Prices experience a larger or smaller change than between 1979 and 1988?
NC.A: The change in total natural gas prices between 1990 and 1992 was {smaller} than between 1979 and 1988.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {SkyFlow Water Index} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {GeoHeat Commodity, Solara Power Futures, AquaSource Trading, Zephyr Gas Index, SkyFlow Water Index}.
